sub_title: Renewable Energy Consultant at Self Employed Energy Consultant/Multiple Companies
summary: Rob has spent his career working in the Renewable / Power industries in Europe, the United States and Australia. His core competencies are solar and wind design, interconnection, and overhead/underground transmission and substation design. He has spent the past several years working as an independent consultant for utility-scale solar and offshore wind projects. Prior to working as an independent consultant, Rob was leading a transmission and distribution group in New York where he was responsible for $20M+ of engineering work, as well as program management of a $2B capital works program for overhead/underground transmission lines and substations.

awards.title: Young Professional Engineer of the Year Nominee

profile_positions.description:
—	Detailed electrical design for 800MW offshore wind generation off the coast of USA, primarily focused on foundation transition piece electrical design
—	Detailed electrical design for 800MW offshore substation off the coast of USA
—	Development of AC and DC transmission alternatives and cost estimating for 1600MW of offshore wind generation off the coast of USA. Electrical design included offshore and onshore cabling as well as substation/converter station design (connection to PJM). 
—	Several 110 kV cable projects in the Netherlands, including cable design and EMC/EMF studies. 
—	Insulation coordination studies for +/- 320 kV HVDC underground cable in Germany
—	Electrical design review of 120MV AC solar project in Texas, USA, primarily focused on 138/34.5 kV substation and 34.5 kV collector network design
—	Electrical design review of 70MW AC solar project in North Carolina, USA, primarily focused on 230/34.5 kV substation and 34.5 kV collector network design
—	Detailed electrical design for 133MW AC solar project in NSW, Australia, including 33 kV, low voltage AC, and DC design.  
—	Multiple standards and design advisory workshops for offshore turbine and substation developers interested in US offshore projects.
—	EMC studies for 380 kV and 110 kV overhead lines in the Netherlands to assess coupled voltages into nearby above and below ground infrastructure
—	Line uprating studies using PLS-CADD for 5 x 380kV overhead transmission lines in the Netherlands
—	Electrical design for 34.5 kV collector network for 180 MW solar generation spread across 8 PV sites in New York State. 
—	Design review for 16MW offshore wind generation off the coast of USA (connection to PJM). 
—	Preliminary electrical design, feeder routing analysis, interconnection studies and cost estimating for 75MW AC solar project in South Africa.
profile_positions.title: Renewable Energy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Responsible for overseeing management of $1.8B capital works program - leading a team of 15 full time engineers and 6 sub-consulting companies to provide Owner's Engineering services for project/program management and design/constructability reviews for 135 overhead transmission, 55 underground transmission, and 35 substation projects ranging from 69kV to 500kV. Through these design and constructabilty reviews, an estimated $53M in savings was provided to the client over 2 years. Sample projects include:
    o	9 miles of solid dielectric 230kV underground cables installed in Washington DC
    o	30 miles of overhead 230kV transmission line installed in Southern New Jersey
    o	Retermination of several 69kV, 138kV and 230kV lines into a new substation in New Jersey
    o	Submarine solid dielectric 138kV cable installed via HDD in Ocean City, Maryland
    o	Structure and foundation design for multiple 69/15kV and 69kV/12kV substations in New Jersey and   Delaware
    o	138/15kV substation expansion to include additional transformer and switchbays in Delaware
    o	Aging condition H-frame and lightning mast replacement for 5 substations in Delware for 69kV, 138kV and 230kV equipment
    o	Stormwater management design for Kings Creek substation, Delaware
•	Responsible for developing appropriate program management tools, design/constructability review procedures, and consultant performance evaluation techniques. 
•	Worked closely with WSP Renewables group to develop AC and DC transmission alternatives for a 1600MW of offshore wind generation off the coast of Massachusetts   
•	Required to constantly collaborate with external stakeholders to effectively deliver projects on time, within budget, and to a high quality. These stakeholders include Engineering, Environmental, Property, Public Relations, Communications, Distribution, and Government Affairs.  
•	Responsible for Business development and strategic/financial planning
profile_positions.title: Head Of Department

profile_positions.description:
I am an expert user and have led training workshops for the following industry standard software packages:
CDEGS, PLS-CADD (inc. LiDAR), EMTP-RV, PSS/E, Paladin Designbase

I have successfully led multidisciplinary teams in the delivery of numerous projects involving:

Complex line design work from feasibility, costings and conceptual designs to detailed electrical and structural design for both new feeders and remediation / uprating works. (66kV - 500kV)

Insulation coordination studies into lightning protection at wind farms and substations developing detailed simulations of transient electrical phenomena such as wave propagation and reflection, non-linear electrical characteristics of surge protection devices, and the relationship between the physical and electrical parameters of a system.

Earthing design and analysis, including current splits under fault conditions for lines and underground cables, soil modeling, EPR studies, step, touch and transfer voltage calculations.

Analysis of EMF from substations, overhead lines and underground cables, including general health effects of magnetic fields, nuisance shocks from electric fields, and coupling studies into pipelines, fences, etc, along with potential mitigation measures, such as isolation, earthing, and shielding.
profile_positions.title: Senior Engineer
